notesStmt.note: Leather surface abraded, sometimes erasing text. Salt accretions. Some old patch repairs. Text transferred to verso through damp and pressure.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 15 membranes, in three parts (of 8, 4 and 3 membranes each, 6226mm, 3047mm, 2413mm long respectively).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square script of the 16th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Presented to the British Museum by Maj.-Gen. V. Eyre on 25 February 1867: inscribed on verso.
